newsitem.title: CANADA: Trilon says will tender stake to high bid.
newsitem.headline: Trilon says will tender stake to high bid.

text.p: Trilon Financial Corp said on Tuesday it will tender its 57-percent stake in London Insurance Group to Great-West Lifeco Inc's C$2.9 billion bid for the insurer if Royal Bank of Canada does not match the Great-West offer.

"We're in a position to wait and see what the Royal Bank will do... if they fail to match (the Great-West bid) we would (tender our stake to the Great-West bid)," Trilon spokesman George Myhall said in a telephone interview.
Royal Bank has three days to respond to the competing bid for London Insurance.
Canada's largest bank in June bid C$2.4 billion for London Insurance.
"We're clearly happy for all of our shareholders... that a better offer has emerged," Myhall added.
Great-West's C$33.50 per share bid, which represents a 21 percent premium over Royal Bank's C$27.50 per share bid, surprised the Canadian stock market Tuesday.
The Royal Bank deal was thought to have been sewn up after Trilon, London Insurance's majority shareholder, agreed to tender its stake to that offer in June.
